title: Six people dead after alleged dynamite attack in Bolivia gold-mining clash
snippets: The dynamite attack is thought to be the result of two mining collectives fighting over access to gold deposits.
summary: A dynamite attack occurred due to a conflict between two mining collectives competing for access to gold deposits.
titles: Six people dead after alleged dynamite attack in Bolivia gold-mining clash

title: Israel launches deadly ground incursion amid air strikes on Syria
snippets: UN envoy for Syria slams ‘repeated’ military attacks by Israel in Syria, warning of violations of international law.
summary: The UN envoy for Syria criticized Israel for its frequent military strikes in Syria, stating these actions could be breaches of international law. This condemnation highlights concerns over the legality of Israel's operations within Syrian territory.
titles: Israel launches deadly ground incursion amid air strikes on Syria

title: Gaza faces ‘largest orphan crisis’ in modern history, report says
snippets: Over 39,000 children have lost one or both parents in Gaza, new report by the Palestinian statistics agency says.
summary: A new report from the Palestinian statistics agency reveals that over 39,000 children in Gaza have lost one or both parents.
titles: Gaza faces ‘largest orphan crisis’ in modern history, report says

title: Trump tariffs trigger steepest US stocks drop since 2020 as China, EU vow to hit back
snippets: Nike and Apple were among brands worst hit, but Trump maintained the US economy would ultimately "boom".
summary: Nike and Apple were significantly affected by an unspecified event, experiencing negative impacts on their brands. Despite this, President Trump asserted that the US economy would eventually experience substantial growth.
titles: Trump tariffs trigger steepest US stocks drop since 2020 as China, EU vow to hit back

title: Hezbollah at crossroads after blows from war weaken group
snippets: The BBC's Hugo Bachega explores the future for Hezbollah in the wake of Israel's devastating attacks.
summary: Hugo Bachega of the BBC investigates the potential future of Hezbollah following significant attacks by Israel. The report delves into the impact these events may have on the organization's operations and standing.
titles: Hezbollah at crossroads after blows from war weaken group

title: Florida center Olivier Rioux enjoys Final Four experience from record-breaking vantage point

summary: The Guinness Book of World Records has recognized a redshirt freshman from the Florida Gators as the world's tallest teenager.
titles: Florida center Olivier Rioux enjoys Final Four experience from record-breaking vantage point

titles: Tottenham's identity crisis on full display in loss at Chelsea: Can Ange Postecoglu and company recover?

summary: Arsenal is planning a significant summer transfer bid for Nico Williams, a player from Athletic Club and Spain international. Last summer, Barcelona also showed interest in acquiring Williams following his performance in the UEFA competitions.

title: Curry, Podziemski overwhelm Lakers in Warriors' win
snippets: With playoff positioning on the line, the Lakers and Warriors squared off in a Western Conference showdown.
summary: In a critical Western Conference matchup with playoff implications, the Los Angeles Lakers faced the Golden State Warriors. The outcome of this game was significant for the playoff positioning of both teams.
titles: Curry, Podziemski overwhelm Lakers in Warriors' win

title: Morant uses finger-gun gesture despite warning
snippets: Grizzlies guard Ja Morant risked further action from the NBA after mimicking shooting a gun with his finger during Thursday night's 110-108 win at the Heat.
summary: Ja Morant, a guard for the Memphis Grizzlies, could face consequences from the NBA for mimicking a gun with his finger during a game against the Miami Heat, which the Grizzlies won 110-108 on Thursday night.
titles: Morant uses finger-gun gesture despite warning

title: Global stock sell-off deepens after tariff rout
snippets: European markets follow Asia down as investors seek refuge from Trump’s tariff blitz
summary: European markets experienced a decline, following Asia's downturn, as investors moved away from risk due to concerns over tariffs introduced by President Trump. This shift indicates a global apprehension towards the potential economic impact of these tariffs.
titles: Global stock sell-off deepens after tariff rout

title: Trump’s sweeping tariffs ignite $2.5tn rout on Wall Street
snippets: US president defends levies even as market behemoths, including Apple, sink most in years
summary: The US President defended the implementation of levies, despite significant market impacts, including a notable downturn in major companies such as Apple, which experienced its most substantial decline in years.
titles: Trump’s sweeping tariffs ignite $2.5tn rout on Wall Street

title: Trump triggers race to offer US concessions before tariffs hit
snippets: Nations prepare offers to Washington including weapons deals, dropping their own tariffs and moves against China
summary: Several countries are proposing various offers to the United States, which include weapons deals, the elimination of their tariffs, and actions against China. These proposals are being prepared as part of their diplomatic engagements with Washington.
titles: Trump triggers race to offer US concessions before tariffs hit

title: Europe braces for flood of Chinese goods after US tariffs
snippets: EU officials ready emergency measures to prevent onslaught of discounted products in ‘economic nightmare’
summary: EU officials are preparing emergency measures to protect the market from a flood of discounted products, aiming to prevent what they describe as an 'economic nightmare.' These steps are designed to shield the European economy from potential harm caused by an influx of cheap imports.
titles: Europe braces for flood of Chinese goods after US tariffs

title: America’s astonishing act of self-harm
snippets: Trump’s tariffs will upend the global economic order and tarnish US prosperity
summary: The imposition of tariffs by Trump is anticipated to disrupt the global economic order and negatively impact US prosperity, according to various news sources.
titles: America’s astonishing act of self-harm

title: 3-D Printed skin to replace animal testing
snippets: A research team is developing a 3D-printed skin imitation equipped with living cells in order to test nanoparticles from cosmetics without animal testing.
summary: A research team is working on creating a 3D-printed skin model that contains living cells. This innovation aims to test nanoparticles used in cosmetics, offering an alternative to animal testing.
titles: 3-D Printed skin to replace animal testing

title: Picky eaters by day, buffet by night: Butterfly, moth diets sync to plant aromas
snippets: The scent of blooming flowers and fresh plant life is not just a perk of springtime; it is a key driver in the survival and evolution of butterflies and moths. New research reveals how the daily cycles of plant aromas are linked to the dietary habits and evolution of the winged insects collectively known as Lepidoptera.
summary: New research has found that the scent of blooming flowers and fresh plants, a common feature of spring, plays a crucial role in the survival and evolution of butterflies and moths, known as Lepidoptera. The study highlights how the daily cycles of plant aromas are closely tied to the dietary habits and evolutionary paths of these winged insects.
titles: Picky eaters by day, buffet by night: Butterfly, moth diets sync to plant aromas

title: Drug-delivering aptamers target leukemia stem cells for one-two knockout punch
snippets: Drug-carrying DNA aptamers can deliver a one-two punch to leukemia by precisely targeting the elusive cancer stem cells that seed cancer relapses, researchers report. The aptamers -- short single-strand snippets of DNA that can target molecules like larger antibodies do -- not only deliver cancer-fighting drugs, but also are themselves toxic to the cancer stem cells, the researchers said.
summary: Researchers have developed DNA aptamers capable of targeting and killing leukemia cancer stem cells, which are responsible for cancer relapses. These aptamers deliver cancer-fighting drugs directly to the cells and are inherently toxic to them, offering a dual-action treatment approach.
titles: Drug-delivering aptamers target leukemia stem cells for one-two knockout punch

title: Physicists uncover electronic interactions mediated via spin waves
snippets: Physicists have made a novel discovery regarding the interaction of electronic excitations via spin waves. The finding could open the door to future technologies and advanced applications such as optical modulators, all-optical logic gates, and quantum transducers.
summary: Physicists discovered a new way electronic excitations interact through spin waves, potentially advancing future technologies. This breakthrough could lead to the development of optical modulators, all-optical logic gates, and quantum transducers, marking a significant step in the field.
titles: Physicists uncover electronic interactions mediated via spin waves

title: Climate change and prehistoric human populations: Eastward shift of settlement areas at the end of the last ice age
snippets: An archaeological study of human settlement during the Final Palaeolithic revealed that populations in Europe did not decrease homogenously during the last cold phase of the Ice Age. Significant variation in regional population sizes indicate differentiated reactions nested in an overall shift of settlement areas towards the east.
summary: A recent archaeological study found that during the last cold phase of the Ice Age, human populations in Europe did not uniformly decrease. Instead, there was significant variation in regional population sizes, with an overall trend of settlements shifting eastward. This indicates that communities responded differently to the climate conditions.
titles: Climate change and prehistoric human populations: Eastward shift of settlement areas at the end of the last ice age
